elements.title: NZME Board Leadership – Barbara Chapman and Carol Campbell

data.value: Independent Chairman of the NZME Board. Previously served as Chief Executive and Managing Director of ASB Bank Limited from 2011 until February 2018. Has extensive experience in banking and insurance, holding senior roles in retail banking, marketing, communications, HR and life insurance. Also holds positions at Genesis Energy Limited (Chairman), Fletcher Building Limited, Bank of New Zealand, serves as Deputy Chair of The New Zealand Initiative and Patron of the New Zealand Rainbow Excellence Awards. Appointed NZME Board Chairman in June 2020.

Independent Director on the NZME Board. A Chartered Accountant and Fellow of CAANZ, with over 25 years as a partner at Ernst & Young and 10 years as a professional director. Chairs NZME’s Audit and Risk Committee and holds additional board roles at NZ Post Limited, Kiwibank Limited, T&G Global Limited, Asset Plus Limited, and Chubb Insurance Limited.

Independent Director with a strong background in strategy and finance, over 20 years of investment banking experience including serving as Co-Head of Investment Banking in New Zealand for Deutsche Bank and Deutsche Craigs. He has advised on many of New Zealand’s largest capital market transactions and serves as director of Freightways Limited, Goodman (NZ) Limited, and Rangatira Limited.

Independent Director with 25 years of experience in senior leadership roles across media companies, including Group CEO of MediaWorks, Managing Director of Radio Otago, and CEO of RadioWorks. Currently, she is Group CEO and Director of Aspire2 Group Limited and serves as Pro-chancellor of Auckland University of Technology.

Independent Director and early pioneer in the mobile app industry. He co-founded the world’s first commercial iPhone app company, Polar Bear Farm, and has been instrumental in launching over 100 mobile apps through his award-winning mobile agency Carnival Labs. He has also launched a real-time data warehouse called SOLVE, serves as a director of New Zealand Mint Limited, and advises Tracksuit Limited.

elements.title: NEW ZEALAND MEDIA AND ENTERTAINMENT THE NZME EXECUTIVE TEAM

data.value: Chief Executive Officer. Appointed in March 2016 at NZME, previously served as Chief Financial Officer at NZME. Focused on developing and implementing a group-wide strategy driving growth in subscription, classified offerings, digital and video content. Has extensive senior executive experience including a tenure as CFO at Tower Limited, where he managed multibillion-dollar assets, Pacific Islands operations, an earthquake recovery programme, and the sale of various insurance businesses. Recognized as CFO of the Year in 2014.

Managing Editor. Joined NZME in 2015 and is responsible for over 300 journalists and the overall editorial and news strategy. Oversees a mix of digital, print, audio, and visual storytelling across multiple NZME platforms including New Zealand Herald, nzherald.co.nz, and Newstalk ZB. Played key roles in launching NZ Herald Premium digital subscriptions, the Herald on Sunday, and transitioning the Herald to a compact format. Awarded the Wolfson Scholarship at Cambridge University in 2016.

Chief Commercial Officer. Appointed in 2021 after serving as Chief Revenue Officer at NZME. Oversees revenue growth across NZME platforms and manages direct client relationships. Previously led significant commercial portfolios as Head of Agency, Enterprise, Events, Partnerships, Government and Rural at NZME, and has prior experience at MediaWorks and The Radio Network with a total of 25 years in the media industry.
Acting Chief of OneRoof; appointed January 2023; over 30 years of commercial experience in real estate, advertising, and marketing, including previous role at NZME.
Chief Digital and Publishing Officer; appointed August 2021; previously served as Chief Operating Officer at NZME and held senior transformational roles at MYOB and Vodafone.
Chief Financial Officer; appointed March 2019; joined from Heartland Bank, with a background that includes roles at Ernst & Young and Air New Zealand (25-year career, ending as Deputy CFO).
Chief Marketing Officer; joined in December 2018; formerly Group Marketing Director at Aspire2 Group Limited and held senior leadership roles at MediaWorks, including Head of Marketing.

data.value: Allison joined NZME in 2013 and serves as General Counsel, heading the legal team and managing legal advice and company secretarial services across NZME, as well as leading the Culture & Performance function. Her previous roles include Legal Counsel at Westpac, Group Legal Advisor for a London-based international media group, and a stint in private practice at Kensington Swan. Appointed as Chief Operations Officer in December 2016, Matthew is responsible for NZME’s print product performance and oversees operations functions including print, distribution, print and digital subscriptions, and advertising production. Previously, he served as GM Print Operations at NZME and has over two decades of experience working across NZME’s newspaper brands in various roles spanning finance, commercial, content, and corporate functions. He has led the consolidation of newspaper sales and distribution, developed successful distribution services, and established customer streams for new product launches such as Herald on Sunday and NZH Premium digital subscriptions.

Jason is one of New Zealand’s most experienced audio executives, with extensive experience in music and talk radio. He has held senior roles, including Assistant Content Director at ZM and Content Director of The Hits, where he led the successful rebranding of 'Classic Hits' to 'The Hits' in 2014. In his current role as Head of Talk for NZME, he has driven record audience growth and commercial success for Newstalk ZB, overseeing the radio business and content delivery to support audience and revenue growth.

The Board is ultimately responsible for the effectiveness, oversight and implementation of the Group’s approach to risk management.

The CEO manages strategic, operational and financial risks; monitors progress against targets; and handles day-to-day risk identification, assessment and management, including implementation of risk management controls and policies.

The Company’s Risk Committee assists the CEO and Executive Team by providing a governance forum. It ensures appropriate management of strategic, operational risk, health and safety, legal, regulatory, technology and security matters, and business continuity planning.

The Group faces diverse risks including cyber security, legal and regulatory compliance, financial and market conditions, government policy and political risks, reputation and brand challenges, operational risks, trading conditions, and risks linked to innovation and talent management.
Health and Safety is regularly monitored by the full Board with policies updated and integrated in the Risk Register, and managed by the Risk Committee.

The Group’s risk management framework is assessed at least annually by the Audit & Risk Committee, which reports to the full Board, including reference to additional financial risk details in the consolidated financial statements.

data.key: Waste Committee and Plastic Reduction Project Launch
data.value: Both initiatives were launched in 2020 and accelerated in 2022 across production and distribution teams at the Ellerslie print plant.
Plastic usage decreased from 52 tonnes in 2021 to 49 tonnes in 2022 (a 5% reduction) with an expected reduction of 41,000m of plastic per year.

Implemented measures include removal of general rubbish bins, diverting cardboard from landfill, reusing wood pallets, recycling batteries, ink and toner cartridges, and removal of plastic coffee cups at the Auckland Central office.
29 tonnes of general waste were removed from the print plant in 2022, a 25% reduction compared to 39 tonnes in 2021.
The print operations were awarded the Toitu Enviromark Gold certificate in 2022 and have maintained gold certification since 2011.

Employees traveled 3.8 million km in NZ in 2022 (up from 3.5 million km). Motor vehicle fleet emissions increased to 522 tCO2e from 491 tCO2e, while newspaper distribution network emissions decreased to 2,855 tCO2e (down 5% from 3,000 tCO2e) due to optimized routes.
The motoring website DRIVEN produced a Sustainable Mobility/Motoring guide featuring a clean car feebate calculator to help readers understand government discounts or fees for vehicles.
NZME is in the process of finalising a Responsible Sourcing Policy to guide their sourcing requirements.
